intro: Dissotis benguellensis var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered dissotis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly found in regions such as South Africa and Namibia. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial with slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and often have a glossy appearance. The flowers are usually white or pale pink, with five petals and are arranged in dense inflorescences.
